body_html:
I was able to reproduce your results: using y = dx.mean() instead of y = model(x + dx).sum() causes a noticeable memory leak.

Using y = model(x + dx).sum() I see a really small increase in memory after each iteration (< 100kb), but this might just be some measurement error.
body_text:
I was able to reproduce your results: using y = dx.mean() instead of y = model(x + dx).sum() causes a noticeable memory leak.
Using y = model(x + dx).sum() I see a really small increase in memory after each iteration (< 100kb), but this might just be some measurement error.
body:
I was able to reproduce your results: using `y = dx.mean()` instead of `y = model(x + dx).sum()` causes a noticeable memory leak. 

Using `y = model(x + dx).sum()` I see a really small increase in memory after each iteration (< 100kb), but this might just be some measurement error.
